metadata.title: CVE-2019-9589 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: There is a NULL pointer dereference vulnerability in PSOutputDev::setupResources() located in PSOutputDev.cc in Xpdf 4.01. It can be triggered by sending a crafted pdf file to (for example) the pdftops binary. It allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

notes.note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> can't reproduce with poppler, no indication it is affected code is different in texlive-bin, doesn't look vulnerable ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore.

criterions.comment: poppler package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
texlive-bin package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2018.20181218.49446-2').
xpdf package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
